balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

params.nftId: ID of the NFT to offer
params.price: total price, expressed in USDC units
params.totalShards: how many shards for the NFT

params.nftId: ID of the NFT to claim

uri(uint256).details: See {IERC1155MetadataURI-uri}. This implementation returns the same URI for *all* token types. It relies on the token type ID substitution mechanism https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1155#metadata[defined in the EIP]. Clients calling this function must replace the `\{id\}` substring with the actual token type ID.

CANCEL_PERIOD_LENGTH().notice: for how long can buyers cancel

TIME_BEFORE_CANCEL().notice: how much time buyers must wait before they can cancel

cancel(uint64,uint256).notice: To cancel open offers once the waiting period is over.

fill(uint64,uint256).notice: Called by buyers to partially/fully fill offers, paying in DVT.         These purchases can be cancelled.

getFee(uint256,uint256).notice: Given a price in USDC, uses the oracle's rate to calculate the fees in DVT

openOffer(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Called by sellers to open offers of one NFT, specifying number of units (a.k.a. "shards") and the total price.         Sellers cannot withdraw offers. They're open until completely filled.

redeem(uint256).notice: Caller can redeem and burn all shards to claim the associated NFT

setRate(uint256).notice: Allows an oracle account to set a new rate of DVT per USDC
